title: New Zealand v England: third men’s cricket one-day international – live
summary: The third ODI between New Zealand and England is taking place in Wellington, with live updates provided by our writers. Fans can follow an over-by-over report for detailed insights and commentary. Stay tuned for the latest developments in the match.

title: Poor Nicolas Sarkozy. His hardline views on crime and punishment have come back to bite him
summary: Former French president championed a strict zero-tolerance penal system. However, his access to influential friends during incarceration raises concerns about privilege in the justice system. Guardian Europe columnist Rokhaya Diallo highlights this issue.

title: Gumnuts, baby! How two abseiling horticulturalists rescued specimens from an endangered tree
summary: The threatened Jillaga Ash, a species of eucalyptus (Eucalyptus stenostoma), has been discovered 90 meters down a cliff in Wadbilliga National Park, located in southern New South Wales. This sighting highlights the ongoing conservation challenges for endangered plant species. The discovery adds to efforts aimed at protecting this vulnerable tree.

title: World Series Game 6: Los Angeles Dodgers 3-1 Toronto Blue Jays – as it happened
summary: The Los Angeles Dodgers beat the Blue Jays 3-1, tying the series and setting up a decisive Game 7. The matchup will take place in Toronto on Saturday. David Lengel provided coverage of the game.

title: LA Dodgers hold on in Toronto to force winner-take-all Game 7 in World Series
summary: The Dodgers avoided elimination in Game 6 of the World Series by defeating the Blue Jays 3-1. Yoshinobu Yamamoto delivered a strong performance, leading his team to victory. The win keeps the Dodgers' championship hopes alive.
